articles.headline: The Hunt for Hatchimals, the Elusive Toy of the Holiday Season
articles.snippet: The interactive hatching toys are virtually sold out, and the maker promises more stock — in January.
articles.abstract: The interactive hatching toys are virtually sold out, and the maker promises more stock — in January.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, the creative and design teams at the toy company Spin Master came up with a big idea they called “Hatchimals”— an interactive, furry creature that hatches out of an egg and grows up before your eyes.

articles.headline: Italy Just Handed the Global Economy Another Giant Variable
articles.snippet: As the country’s voters emphatically rejected reforms in a referendum Sunday, they added to grave international uncertainties and prompted the prime minister to resign.
articles.abstract: As the country’s voters emphatically rejected reforms in a referendum Sunday, they added to grave international uncertainties and prompted the prime minister to resign.
articles.lead_paragraph: Global markets were not lacking in precarious unknowns. Italy just added another.

articles.headline: Carson Is New Sign Trump Plans to Govern From the Right
articles.snippet: Announcements of several of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s cabinet posts are helping to define his approach to issues at home.
articles.abstract: Announcements of several of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s cabinet posts are helping to define his approach to issues at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump is moving to repudiate vast parts of President Obama’s domestic agenda as he fills his cabinet with conservatives who have long records opposing the current administration on social programs, wages, public lands, veterans and the environment.

articles.headline: In Washington Pizzeria Attack, Fake News Brought Real Guns
articles.snippet: Edgar M. Welch of North Carolina was charged after a shooting at a Washington pizzeria that he thought was harboring young children as sex slaves.
articles.abstract: Edgar M. Welch of North Carolina was charged after a shooting at a Washington pizzeria that he thought was harboring young children as sex slaves.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Edgar M. Welch, a 28-year-old father of two from Salisbury, N.C., recently read online that Comet Ping Pong, a pizza restaurant in northwest Washington, was harboring young children as sex slaves as part of a child-abuse ring led by Hillary Clinton.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: House G.O.P. Signals Break With Trump Over Tariff Threat
articles.snippet: President-elect Trump has suggested a heavy tax on companies that move jobs overseas, but Republican leaders pushed back, saying they don’t want a trade war.
articles.abstract: President-elect Trump has suggested a heavy tax on companies that move jobs overseas, but Republican leaders pushed back, saying they don’t want a trade war.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republican leaders signaled on Monday that they would not support President-elect Donald J. Trump’s threat to impose a heavy tax on companies that move jobs overseas, the first significant confrontation over the conservative economic orthodoxy that Mr. Trump relishes trampling.

articles.headline: As Avianca Weighs Bids, Hedge Fund Plays Unusual Role: Diplomat
articles.snippet: Delta, United and Copa have made offers to partner with the airline as Elliott Management mediates among shareholders.
articles.abstract: Delta, United and Copa have made offers to partner with the airline as Elliott Management mediates among shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: Trouble was brewing this summer at Avianca Holdings, Latin America’s second-biggest airline.
articles.byline: By Leslie Picker and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Want to Bring Back Jobs, Mr. President-Elect? Call Elon Musk
articles.snippet: The group of luminaries advising Donald J. Trump on job creation is missing Mr. Musk, and he has arguably re-envisioned how the nation can revive its manufacturing.
articles.abstract: The group of luminaries advising Donald J. Trump on job creation is missing Mr. Musk, and he has arguably re-envisioned how the nation can revive its manufacturing.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — Donald Trump: Please think about calling Elon Musk.

articles.headline: Oakland’s ‘Ghost Ship,’ Site of Fire, Was a Motley Warehouse With a History
articles.snippet: The deadly fire in an Oakland warehouse has shed light on an illegal housing boom and prompted questions about whether the building should have been shut down.
articles.abstract: The deadly fire in an Oakland warehouse has shed light on an illegal housing boom and prompted questions about whether the building should have been shut down.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — The first complaint came in 2014. Piles of trash were reported next to the building. Later that year, construction materials blocking the sidewalk drew another complaint. Last month, another was lodged, leading to an investigation of illegal construction inside.
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz, Thomas Fuller, Richard Pérez-Peña and Conor Dougherty

articles.headline: Saudis Bankroll Taliban, Even as King Officially Supports Afghan Government
articles.snippet: Saudi Arabia has voiced support for American efforts to nourish Afghanistan’s democracy, but it has also lavishly funded Sunni extremism under various guises.
articles.abstract: Saudi Arabia has voiced support for American efforts to nourish Afghanistan’s democracy, but it has also lavishly funded Sunni extremism under various guises.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Fifteen years, half a trillion dollars and 150,000 lives since going to war, the United States is trying to extricate itself from Afghanistan. Afghans are being left to fight their own fight. A surging Taliban insurgency, meanwhile, is flush with a new inflow of money.

articles.headline: Google Says It Will Run Entirely on Renewable Energy in 2017
articles.snippet: The internet giant has spent years migrating the source of electric power at its giant data centers to sources like wind turbines and solar panels.
articles.abstract: The internet giant has spent years migrating the source of electric power at its giant data centers to sources like wind turbines and solar panels.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINCO, Okla. — Last year, Google consumed as much energy as the city of San Francisco. Next year, it said, all of that energy will come from wind farms and solar panels.

articles.headline: ‘Cancel Order!’ Donald Trump Attacks Plans for Upgraded Air Force One
articles.snippet: In a message that seemed to come out of the blue, Mr. Trump took to Twitter to object to Boeing’s plans for a next-generation presidential plane.
articles.abstract: In a message that seemed to come out of the blue, Mr. Trump took to Twitter to object to Boeing’s plans for a next-generation presidential plane.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump took a shot on Tuesday at one of the nation’s largest manufacturers, Boeing, sharply criticizing a pending order for a new Air Force One and suggesting that the company was “doing a little bit of a number” with the cost of the next generation of presidential aircraft.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Christopher Drew
